full_threads.body:
Google brings back the whip after 8 months of silence, and your entry into the USD$3 billion voice market just got easier.

Labor Day? Nah! How About Labor Week?


Labor Day is supposed to honor hard work, and what's harder than explaining to your boss why traffic dropped after the last update?

For that, we're giving you 10% off Marketplace tools and backlinks for the entire Labor week. Your boss doesn't need to know it was on sale: Secure your 10% off this week*.

*This offer can't be combined with other promos or discounts, including Agency and Enterprise user rates. But for the rest of you, this week is your only holiday from overpriced SEO survival gear.

Secure your 10% off this week

**


Three (or so) Weeks of Hell? Google Strikes After 8 Months of Silence


On August 26, 2025, Google rolled the (in)famous spam update that will "run for the next few weeks". The last time Google swung the hammer this hard was in December 2024, we were still pretending AI summaries wouldn't eat the SERPs. Look at us now!

Who Should Be Concerned?

Everyone. However: 

  • If you bought a 'too good to be true' expired domain last year, Google may notice, and it'll not be pretty.
  • If your "city landing pages" look like Mad Libs: [City] + "best plumbers" is now officially a liability. Doorways have always been red flags.
  • If you leaned too hard on AI blogs without editing: you've basically been serving up lorem ipsum with meta tags. Scaled content abuse is in the crosshairs.
  • If your affiliate reviews read like the product manual: you're not "monetizing," you're a thin affiliate template, and Google just stopped tolerating it.
  • If you've ignored site security for years: hackers may have shown you love, but Google won't. Cloaked pages and injected redirects may just tank the whole domain, not just the infected bits.


The Takeaway

Updates like this are personal. Google isn't looking for "low quality," it's hunting patterns. If you've been cutting corners (or ignoring them on purpose), you're at risk. Every update leaves bodies in the SERPs. The only question is whether you're piling on top or still clawing your way out.

**


1 Billion Searches Ignored Your Site This Month. An Opportunity to Fix That Just Opened

Your competitors are already in people's ears. Multi-speaker AI is narrating their content while your blog sits in silence.

Microsoft is about to change that, thanks to VibeVoice, a framework designed for "generating expressive, long-form, multi-speaker conversational audio, such as podcasts, from text."


Here's why you should care:

  • Voice is eating the SERP for breakfast. Smartphones dominate at 56% of usage, and 153 million Americans are talking to assistants daily. That's a massive audience ignoring your content.
  • Of the one billion monthly voice searches, half of them in the U.S. happen daily. 
  • Users actually like voice. 93% are satisfied with their assistants, meaning they trust what they hear. If your competitor's content is being read out loud, that trust attaches to them, not you.
  • Smart speakers = high-intent ad real estate. That's eyeballs, ears, and wallets all waiting for you.


The Takeaway

The door's open. Structure your content for voice queries, conversational flow, and multi-speaker formats. Otherwise, you'll keep being invisible while your competitors' AI voices eat up traffic, trust, and conversions you should own.

**


NO-BS Housekeeping Edition


This week's 60-second SEO chore: Dust off one meta title.

Your title tag is the first thing Google and users see. If it's vague, duplicated, or a mile long, you're basically putting up a "Closed for Business" sign.

Here's the quick fix:

Step 1: Pick one underperforming page from Google Search Console or your site.

Step 2: Open the source or CMS and find the <title>.

Step 3: Ask yourself three questions:

- Is it under 60 characters?

- Does it actually describe the page (and not just "Home")?

- Does it hit one main keyword?

Step 4: Rewrite it. Be clear, relevant, and specific.

Step 5: Save, publish, and reindex in Google Search Console.

And that's it, you just gave Google one less excuse to ignore you.

**


Quote of the Week


"Voice search isn't the future. It's the 1 billion queries you already ignored this month.""

And that's Wasserp in search this week. See you at Seven.
NO-BS Marketplace

131 Continental Drive, Suite 305
19713 Newark, Delaware
United States
